Hello.

If there are no objections, I'd like to write an ebuild for Cantera. 
Ebuilds are buildfiles for Portage, which is the source-based package
management system for Gentoo Linux (http://www.gentoo.org/).

To do so, I need the makefiles to acknowledge the DESTDIR environment
variable.  With that done, it will be possible to configure Cantera
for its ultimate destination (/usr, in this case), but actually
install it someplace else (here, a sandboxed environment until it is
merged with the live filesystem).  I have already
made the necessary changes to my copy of the makefile.

Since the changes are fully backward-compatible, and since they will
make packaging easier [or even possible] for source-based
distributions, would it be possible to merge the changes into the
current version of Cantera?

Thanks very much!

-Jon Chambers
